message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.PF 

This paper deals with the design of information-update systems, which involves the transmission of packets through multiple servers. This topic is closely related to networked systems and communication networks, which are covered in the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. The paper also discusses the optimization of performance metrics such as throughput and delay, which are key topics in the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper considers the use of policies to manage packet dropping and delivery, which is a topic in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of queueing systems to model the information-update process, which is a topic in the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the age-of-information metric, which is a topic in the cs.PF (Performance) sub-category.
